span.div: Welcome to Sonora Elementary School website!

Feel free to browse through our site. Please check our Upcoming Events and the For Parents section for the latest information for your student. We have a Facebook page as well, look for our school logo and a picture of the school bell - to check it out, click here!

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.h1: TK/K Online Registration for 2020-21 Now Available

span.p: Sonora Elementary School is pleased to offer online registration for Transitional Kindergarten and Kindergarten students for 2020-21 school year as an alternate to in-person registration during the COVID-19 closure. The online registration jumpstarts our traditional student enrollment process and is subject to verification before the enrollment process is complete.
Children who will be five years old between September 2, 2020 and December 2, 2020 are eligible to be registered for Transitional Kindergarten.
Children who are five years old on or before September 1, 2020 are eligible to be registered for Kindergarten.
Immunizations are required by the State of California. Information regarding what immunizations your child needs to register in school can be found by clicking here.
Proof of residency and medical history information will be requested during the online registration process. Please gather this information before you start to register a child.
Idioma español está disponible.
To go to our Online Registration and register your child, click here: Sonora Elementary Online Registration

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: School may be closed because of Covid-19, but the Sonora Elementary Annual Lip Sync is going to live on!! We will have to do this a little differntly than before, but we are still going to try! Lyrics need to be emailed to Mrs. Katz by April 24, 2020. Please click the link to get detailed information. PICK YOUR SONGS!!!

a.title: Go to comments for 8th Grade Lip Synch 2020

span.p: Tuolumne County Superintendant of Schools has posted resources that were assembled by K-12 technology support teams from around California in an effort to assist all K-12 education agencies with providing distance learning opportunities to their students during the extended school closures (as a response to COVID-19). More than 60 high quality, vetted resources are already available. Teachers, parents, and students can access the ELO daily lessons beginning Monday, March 30. To access these online resources at the TCSOS ELO Portal, click here.

a.title: Go to comments for TCSOS Resources

span.p: Help keep your students learning at home. Check out our list of online resources for links to teacher class pages, activities and other resources like virtual museums, webcams, videos to stream and more. Visit our list in the For Parents section by clicking here.

Student enrichment activity packets are available for pick up during meal distribution for students that do not have internet access to help keep your child learning at home. Check our calendar for upcoming dates and times.

a.title: Go to comments for Learning Resources

span.p: Due to the current school closure for COVID-19 as ordered by the county superintendent of schools office, TK-Kindergarten Registration Day is being postponed. Our Online Registration above is an alternate you can use during the Covid-19 Closure. We will reschedule the registration day in the future and let you know when that will be. We apologize for any inconvenience.

a.title: Go to comments for TK/K Registration Day Postponed

p.strong: OPT-IN SCHOOL MESSENGER FOR TEXT MESSAGES

span.p: Those who are listed as contacts for an enrolled student can opt-in to receive notifications via text message. If your telephone number is not in our student information system, your request will be denied.
Send a text with "Subscribe" to 67587
Send a text with "STOP" to 67587

a.title: Go to comments for Opt IN TEXT MESSAGES

span.p: Currently several areas are temporarily disrupted for construction of our new building. A fence surrounds the construction area to keep students out of the area.
Please do not enter the construction area and be extra cautious and safety minded whenever you visit the campus.

a.title: Go to comments for CONSTRUCTION ON CAMPUS

span.p: The Sonora School Board is seeking “Parent “ and “Community” representatives to serve a four-year term on the Citizens Oversight Committee. The purpose of the Citizens Oversight Committee (COC) is to inform the public concerning the expenditures of bond revenues. The committee normally meets on a quarterly basis. An interested citizen would need to be a parent who has a child enrolled at Sonora Elementary or a person living within the Sonora Elementary school district boundaries. Please contact Leigh Shampain @ 532-5491 for further information.

a.title: Go to comments for WANTED: BOARD MEMBERS FOR COC

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: SES Parents/Staff,

With much sadness, it is my job to inform you all that the Sonora Elementary School District, in collaboration of a unified decision across Tuolumne County, will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Distance Learning and meal distribution will be in effect for the remainder of the 2019-2020 School Year.

It is important to understand we are not ending the school year and we are continuing the essential work of teaching and learning for all Sonora Elementary School students, through our teaching staff and resources at the County Level. We will continue to provide communication, information and learning resources through a variety of platforms.
Take care,
Chris Boyles, Principal

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.h4: DRIVE THRU FREE MEAL PICK UP WILL BE MONDAYS ONLY FROM 11:30-1:00 P.M. Any child age 1-18 is eligible for the free meals, your child does not need to be enrolled at Sonora Elementary to receive meals. Please help us prepare enough meals, call (209) 532-3159 extension 4111 and let us know how many children need meals.

h4.br: Monday meal pick up will be breakfast and lunch meals for 5 days. Meal pick up is drive-through service only. Please enter the campus parking lot at the traffic signal on Greenley Road. Once you enter the campus parking lot, please follow the one way BUS ONLY lane. Stop by the multipurpose room building at the end of the loop. Stay in your vehicle, do not park. We will bring the meals to your vehicle. Please use caution when exiting the campus.

span.h4: STUDENT ENRICHMENT ACTIVITY PACKET PICK UP CONTINUES ON MONDAYS and WEDNESDAYS FROM 11:30-1:00 P.M. Follow the BUS ONLY lane, remain in your vehicle, stop by the D building metal fence to let us know what teacher your child has and we will provide the packet if they have prepared material for students.

h4.strong: Sonora Elementary is participating in Tuolumne County Superintendent of Schools Common Wifi and is offering free secured and filtered wifi hotspots at specific areas on campuses around the county for use by families without internet service. The areas at Sonora Elementary where the wifi is available are the main parking lot and the shaded lunch structure at the front of the school. Sonora Elementary families will receive a School Messenger message with the connection and password information. Please remember to use social distancing when coming to campus to access the hotspots. Refer to the circled areas below where this wifi access is available.

span.p: Our Student/Parent Handbook is updated annually at the start of the school year. You can download a PDF copy by clicking above.

a.title: Go to comments for 2019-20 Student/Parent Handbook

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: The Tuolumne County Department of Public Heath web page (link available below) is a great resource to keep on top of local reporting and updates on the virus that is now known as SARS-CoV-2. In addition to local offices, Sonora Elementary administrators remain in daily contact with the Tuolumne County Superintendent of Schools office, the Tuolumne County Department of Public Health, California Department of Education, and other state officials.

Sonora Elementary School is closed through May 1, 2020 per the order of the Tuolumne Superintendent of Schools Office. We are in contact with local officials and coordinating with other districts to deliver student meals during the closure. Our website calendar and the Upcoming Events sections above will reflect the times and locations for meal pick ups when the locations and schedules are finalized. In the meantime we have the following reccomendations:

ul.li: Encourage your students to engage in learning activities with resources that are available to you on a daily basis.
Practice social distancing if you have to go out for grocery shopping and other essential needs.

span.p: We have sent out a letter to parents/guardians regarding the virus. A copy of the letter is on our website and can be viewed or downloded click here
Please visit the websites below if you require more information about COVID-19, recommended cleaning and disinfecting, and guidelines to talk with your children about the virus.
span.h3: Websites for resources and information (click to open):

a.strong: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Coronavirus Disease 2019

strong.a: California Department of Public Health COVID-19 Updates
